Title: PECL HTTP: Remote execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow in PECL HTTP might allow remote attackers to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: This HTTP extension aims to provide a convenient and powerful set of functionality for one of PHPs major applications.

Description.Text: A buffer overflow can be triggered in the URL parsing functions of the PECL HTTP extension. This allows overflowing a buffer with data originating from an arbitrary HTTP request.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, through a specially crafted URI, could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All PECL HTTP users should upgrade to the latest version:
